question: Which of the following is an example of horizontal scaling in the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Replacing an existing EC2 instance with a larger, more powerful one.
options.B: Increasing the compute capacity of a single EC2 instance to address the growing demands of an application.
options.C: Adding more RAM capacity to an EC2 instance.
options.D: Adding more EC2 instances of the same size to handle an increase in traffic.

explanation: Horizontal scaling means adding more instances of the same size to distribute load, rather than making a single instance bigger (which is vertical scaling).

question: Which statement is true regarding the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?

options.A: Responsibilities vary depending on the services used.
options.B: Security of the IaaS services is the responsibility of AWS.
options.C: Patching the guest OS is always the responsibility of AWS.
options.D: Security of the managed services is the responsibility of the customer.

explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, who is responsible for what shifts depending on the service type — for managed services AWS takes on more, while for IaaS the customer handles more of the stack.

question: A Japanese company hosts their applications on Amazon EC2 instances in the Tokyo Region. The company has opened new branches in the United States, and the US users are complaining of high latency. What can the company do to reduce latency for the users in the US while minimizing costs?

options.A: Applying the Amazon Connect latency-based routing policy.
options.B: Registering a new US domain name to serve the users in the US.
options.C: Building a new data center in the US and implementing a hybrid model.
options.D: Deploying new Amazon EC2 instances in a Region located in the US.

explanation: Deploying EC2 instances in a US Region places compute resources physically closer to US users, directly reducing network latency at minimal additional cost.

question: Adjusting compute capacity dynamically to reduce cost is an implementation of which AWS cloud best practice?
explanation: Elasticity is the cloud practice of dynamically scaling compute capacity up or down based on demand, which avoids over-provisioning and reduces costs.

question: One of the most important AWS best-practices to follow is the cloud architecture principle of elasticity. How does this principle improve your architecture’s design?

options.A: By automatically scaling your on-premises resources based on changes in demand.
options.B: By automatically scaling your AWS resources using an Elastic Load Balancer.
options.C: By reducing interdependencies between application components wherever possible.
options.D: By automatically provisioning the required AWS resources based on changes in demand.

explanation: Elasticity means AWS automatically provisions or de-provisions resources in response to real-time changes in demand, ensuring you only use and pay for what you need.

question: Which of the following does NOT belong to the AWS Cloud Computing models?
explanation: The three AWS cloud computing models are IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS. Networking as a Service (NaaS) is not an AWS cloud model.

question: Select TWO examples of the AWS shared controls.
explanation: Shared controls are responsibilities that both AWS and the customer manage independently. Patch Management (AWS patches infrastructure, customers patch their OS/apps) and Configuration Management both fall into this category.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the responsibility of AWS?
explanation: Configuring infrastructure devices (networking hardware, physical servers, etc.) is entirely AWS's responsibility under the Shared Responsibility Model, as customers have no access to the underlying physical infrastructure.

question: In the AWS Shared responsibility Model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)

options.B: Controlling physical access to compute resources.

explanation: Setting password complexity rules and configuring network access rules (like security groups and NACLs) are customer responsibilities — the customer controls their own identity policies and network configuration.

question: Which of the following is the customer’s responsibility under the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, customers are responsible for patching the operating system and software on EC2 instances they launch. AWS patches the underlying hypervisor, physical hardware, and network infrastructure.

question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model who is responsible for configuration management?

options.A: It is solely the responsibility of the customer.
options.B: It is solely the responsibility of AWS.
options.C: It is shared between AWS and the customer.
options.D: It is not part of the AWS shared responsibility model.

explanation: Configuration management is a shared control: AWS manages the configuration of its infrastructure, while the customer is responsible for configuring the operating systems, databases, and applications they deploy.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the AWS customer? (Select TWO)

options.A: Ensuring that application data is encrypted at rest.
options.B: Ensuring that AWS NTP servers are set to the correct time.
options.C: Ensuring that users have received security training in the use of AWS services.
options.D: Ensuring that access to data centers is restricted.
options.E: Ensuring that hardware is disposed of properly.

explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting their application data at rest and for training their users on proper security practices. AWS is responsible for NTP server accuracy, physical data center access, and hardware disposal.

question: Web servers running on Amazon EC2 access a legacy application running in a corporate data center. What term would describe this model?
explanation: When applications in the AWS cloud communicate with a legacy application in a corporate data center, this is a hybrid architecture—combining on-premises and cloud resources in a single solution.

question: Which of the following is a correct relationship between regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations?
explanation: Regions are geographic areas that contain multiple Availability Zones. Each AZ consists of one or more data centers. Edge locations are separate points of presence for CloudFront, not contained within AZs.

question: Distributing workloads across multiple Availability Zones supports which cloud architecture design principle?
explanation: Distributing workloads across multiple Availability Zones ensures the application can continue operating if one AZ fails, embodying the 'design for failure' principle—the architecture anticipates and accommodates component failures.

question: A company wants to expand from one AWS Region into a second AWS Region. What does the company need to do to start supporting the new Region?

options.A: Contact an AWS Account Manager to sign a new contract.
options.B: Move an Availability Zone to the new Region.
options.C: Begin deploying resources in the second Region.
options.D: Download the AWS Management Console for the new Region.

explanation: AWS Regions are available globally and customers can begin provisioning resources in any Region at any time through the console, CLI, or API—no contract or separate download is needed.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is the customer responsible for?

options.A: Ensuring that disk drives are wiped after use.
options.B: Ensuring that firmware is updated on hardware devices.
options.C: Ensuring that data is encrypted at rest.
options.D: Ensuring that network cables are category six or higher.

explanation: Data encryption at rest is a customer responsibility under the shared responsibility model—AWS provides the encryption tools and services, but the customer decides whether and how to encrypt their data. AWS is responsible for hardware firmware, disk wiping, and network cabling.

question: What is an advantage of deploying an application across multiple Availability Zones?

options.A: There is a lower risk of service failure if a natural disaster causes a service disruption in a given AWS Region.
options.B: The application will have higher availability because it can withstand a service disruption in one Availability Zone.
options.C: There will be better coverage as Availability Zones are geographical^ distant and can serve a wider area.
options.D: There will be decreased application latency that will improve the user experience.

explanation: When one Availability Zone experiences an outage, traffic fails over to instances in the other AZ(s), keeping the application running. Multiple AZs within a Region do not protect against a full-Region disaster, but they do provide protection against single-AZ failures.

question: A company will be moving from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud. What would be one financial difference after the move?

options.A: Moving from variable operational expense ( opex ) to upfront capital expense (capex).
options.B: Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable capital expense (capex).
options.C: Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable operational expense ( opex ).
options.D: Elimination of upfront capital expense (capex) and elimination of variable operational expense ( opex ).

explanation: On-premises infrastructure requires large upfront capital expenditures (buying hardware) and ongoing fixed costs. Moving to AWS converts this to variable operational expense—you pay only for what you use, with no upfront hardware purchases.

question: What can AWS edge locations be used for? (Select TWO)

options.D: Reducing traffic on the server by caching responses.
options.E: Sending notification messages to end users.

explanation: CloudFront edge locations deliver cached content (like web pages and videos) closer to end users to reduce latency, and they absorb repeated requests from the origin server, reducing the traffic burden. Edge locations cannot host applications or run database services.

question: One of the advantages to moving infrastructure from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud is:

options.A: It allows the business to eliminate IT bills.
options.B: It allows the business to put a server in each customer’s data center.
options.C: It allows the business to focus on business activities.
options.D: It allows the business to leave servers unpatched.

explanation: By offloading infrastructure management to AWS, companies can redirect their IT staff and resources toward developing and improving their core products and services rather than maintaining data centers.

question: How can a user protect against AWS service disruptions if a natural disaster affects an entire geographic area?

options.A: Deploy applications across multiple Availability Zones within an AWS Region.
options.B: Use a hybrid cloud computing deployment model within the geographic area.
options.C: Deploy applications across multiple AWS Regions.
options.D: Store application artifacts using AWS Artifact and replicate them across multiple AWS Regions.

explanation: A natural disaster affecting an entire geographic area could take down a whole AWS Region. Deploying across multiple Regions in different geographies protects against this scenario, unlike multi-AZ deployments which only protect against single-AZ failures within one Region.

question: Which activity is a customer responsibility in the AWS Cloud according to the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.A: Ensuring network connectivity from AWS to the internet.
options.B: Patching and fixing flaws within the AWS Cloud infrastructure.
options.C: Ensuring the physical security of cloud data centers.
options.D: Ensuring Amazon EBS volumes are backed up.

explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, backing up EBS volumes (e.g., taking snapshots) is the customer's responsibility—AWS does not automatically back up EBS volumes. AWS is responsible for network connectivity, infrastructure patching, and physical data center security.

question: A customer is deploying a new application and needs to choose an AWS Region. Which of the following factors could influence the customer’s decision? (Select TWO)

options.B: The application’s presentation in the local language.
options.E: Proximity to the customer’s office for on-site visits.

explanation: Proximity to users (reduced network latency) and data sovereignty/compliance requirements (laws that mandate data stay within certain geographic boundaries) are the two primary technical and regulatory factors in Region selection. Language, cooling, and office proximity are not valid technical criteria.

question: Which disaster recovery scenario offers the lowest probability of down time?
explanation: Multi-site active-active runs fully redundant, live copies of your application across multiple sites simultaneously, so if one site fails, the other immediately serves all traffic with essentially zero downtime. Backup/restore, pilot light, and warm standby all require some recovery time.

question: Which of the following components of the AWS Global Infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers interconnected through low latency links?
explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is composed of one or more discrete data centers, each with independent power and networking, connected to other AZs in the Region via low-latency links. Edge locations and Regions are separate infrastructure layers; private networking is not a global infrastructure component.

question: A characteristic of edge locations is that they:

options.A: Host Amazon EC2 instances closer to users.
options.B: Help lower latency and improve performance for users.
options.C: Cache frequently changing data without reaching the origin server.

explanation: CloudFront edge locations cache content geographically close to end users, reducing round-trip distance and lowering latency to improve performance. They do not host EC2 instances, and they cache static or infrequently changing content—not frequently changing data.

question: What are the benefits of developing and running a new application in the AWS Cloud compared to on-premises? (Select TWO)

options.A: AWS automatically distributes the data globally for higher durability.
options.B: AWS will take care of operating the application.
options.C: AWS makes it easy to architect for high availability.
options.D: AWS can easily accommodate application demand changes.
options.E: AWS takes care of application security patching.

explanation: AWS makes it easy to architect for high availability using multi-AZ deployments, load balancers, and managed services, and the cloud's elasticity allows applications to scale up or down to match demand changes quickly. AWS does not automatically distribute all data globally or take over application operations and security patching.

question: Which of the following is a component of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
explanation: AWS Regions are the physical, geographically distributed components of the AWS Global Infrastructure, each containing multiple Availability Zones. Alexa is a voice assistant service; Lightsail is a compute service; Organizations is an account management tool—none are infrastructure components.

question: A company wants to migrate its applications to a VPC on AWS These applications will need to access on-premises resources. What combination of actions will enable the company to accomplish this goals? (Select TWO)

options.A: Use the AWS Service Catalog to identify a list of on-premises resources that can be migrated
options.B: Build a VPN connection between an on-premises device and a virtual private gateway in the new VPC
options.C: Use Amazon Athena to query data from the on-premises database servers
options.D: Connect the company’s on-premises data center to AWS using AWS Direct Connect
options.E: Leverage Amazon CloudFront to restrict access to static web content provided through the company’s on-premises web servers

explanation: A site-to-site VPN through a virtual private gateway provides an encrypted tunnel over the internet between on-premises and the VPC, and AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private network link—both extend the on-premises network into AWS. Athena queries S3 data; Service Catalog manages product portfolios; CloudFront distributes content.

question: Under the shared responsibility model which of the following areas are the customer’s responsibility? (Select TWO)
explanation: Customers are responsible for patching the operating systems running on their EC2 instances and for configuring security groups to control traffic. AWS manages network infrastructure firmware, the underlying hypervisor, and physical data center security.

question: Which AWS services provide a way to extend an on-premises architecture to the AWS Cloud? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private network connection between on-premises and AWS, and AWS Storage Gateway integrates on-premises storage with cloud storage—both extend an on-premises architecture to the cloud. EBS and CloudFront are cloud-only services; Amazon Connect is a contact center service.

question: How can the AWS Cloud increase user workforce productivity after migration from an on-premises data center?

options.A: Users do not have to wait for infrastructure provisioning.
options.B: The AWS Cloud infrastructure is much faster than an on-premises data center infrastructure.
options.C: AWS takes over application configuration management on behalf of users.
options.D: Users do not need to address security and compliance issues.

explanation: With AWS, developers and engineers can self-provision infrastructure in minutes through the console or APIs, eliminating the waiting time associated with traditional hardware procurement and setup, which directly increases workforce productivity.

question: Which of the following services could be used to deploy an application to servers running on-premises? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS OpsWorks (using Chef/Puppet) can manage configuration and deployments on both AWS and on-premises servers, and AWS CodeDeploy can deploy application code to on-premises servers as well as EC2 instances. Elastic Beanstalk, Batch, and X-Ray are AWS-only services.

question: What is an example of agility in the AWS Cloud?

options.C: Using Consolidated Billing to produce one bill.
options.D: Decreased acquisition time for new compute resources.

explanation: Agility in the AWS Cloud is best illustrated by the dramatically reduced time to acquire and provision new compute resources—minutes instead of weeks—enabling teams to experiment and iterate faster. Multiple instance types, managed services, and consolidated billing are benefits but are not the primary example of agility.

question: You work as an on-premises MySQL DBA. The work of database configuration, backups, patching, and DR can be time-consuming and repetitive. Your company has decided to migrate to the AWS Cloud. Which of the following can help save time on database maintenance so you can focus on data architecture and performance?
explanation: Amazon RDS is a fully managed relational database service where AWS handles configuration, backups, patching, and failover—exactly the tasks described. Redshift is a data warehouse; DynamoDB is NoSQL; CloudWatch is a monitoring service, not a database.

question: According to the AWS Shared responsibility model, which of the following are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Managing environmental events of AWS data centers.
options.B: Protecting the confidentiality of data in transit in Amazon S3.
options.C: Controlling physical access to AWS Regions.
options.D: Ensuring that the underlying EC2 host is configured properly.
options.E: Patching applications installed on Amazon EC2.

explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for protecting data confidentiality in transit to and from S3 (e.g., using HTTPS/TLS), and for patching operating systems and applications installed on EC2 instances. AWS is responsible for managing data center environments, physical access to Regions, and the configuration of the underlying EC2 host.

question: Which of the following is one of the benefits of moving infrastructure from an on-premises data center to AWS?

options.A: Free support for all enterprise customers.
options.D: AWS holds responsibility for managing customer applications.

explanation: Migrating from on-premises to AWS converts large upfront capital expenditures (buying and maintaining physical hardware) into smaller, variable operational expenses—directly reducing CapEx. AWS does not provide free support to all enterprise customers, does not automatically protect data, and does not manage customer applications.

question: Based on the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following are the sole responsibility of AWS? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Creating and managing hypervisors (the software layer that enables virtualization) and maintaining physical hardware are solely AWS's responsibility under the shared responsibility model—customers have no access to or control over these layers. Monitoring network performance, installing EC2 software, and configuring ACLs are customer responsibilities.

question: In your on-premises environment, you can create as many virtual servers as you need from a single template. What can you use to perform the same in AWS?
explanation: An Amazon Machine Image (AMI) is a template that contains the OS, application software, and configuration needed to launch an EC2 instance—directly equivalent to creating virtual machines from a template in an on-premises environment. IAM manages permissions; internet gateways enable VPC internet access; EBS snapshots back up volumes, not instance configurations.

question: What are two advantages of using Cloud Computing over using traditional data centers? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Cloud computing eliminates single points of failure through redundancy (distributed services across multiple data centers) and uses geographically distributed infrastructure so no one physical failure can take down the system. Reserved compute capacity, virtualized resources, and dedicated hosting are on-premises or traditional data center concepts, not advantages of cloud over traditional data centers.

question: AWS has created a large number of Edge Locations as part of its Global Infrastructure. Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using Edge Locations?

options.A: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to cache the most recent responses.
options.B: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to improve your end users’ experience when uploading files.
options.C: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute traffic across multiple instances to reduce latency.
options.D: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to distribute content to global users with low latency.

explanation: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to cache content and deliver it with low latency to global users, and they also improve upload performance (e.g., via S3 Transfer Acceleration). However, edge locations do not distribute traffic across multiple EC2 instances—that is the role of Elastic Load Balancing. Load balancing is the incorrect statement about edge location functionality.

question: Using Amazon RDS falls under the shared responsibility model. Which of the following are customer responsibilities? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Under the shared responsibility model for Amazon RDS, the customer is responsible for designing the database schema (data model) and managing database-level settings such as parameters and user permissions. AWS handles backups, patching the database software, and installing/maintaining the underlying database engine.

question: A company has a large amount of structured data stored in their on-premises data center. They are planning to migrate all the data to AWS, what is the most appropriate AWS database option?
explanation: Amazon RDS is the appropriate service for migrating structured, relational data—it supports multiple SQL engines (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, MariaDB) and provides a managed environment that mirrors on-premises relational database setups. DynamoDB is NoSQL; SNS is a notification service; ElastiCache is an in-memory cache, not a relational database.

question: Which of the following AWS services is designed with native Multi-AZ fault tolerance in mind? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Amazon S3 stores data redundantly across multiple facilities within a Region and is designed with Multi-AZ durability built in by default. Amazon DynamoDB also replicates data across multiple AZs within a Region automatically. Redshift and Snowball are not natively Multi-AZ fault-tolerant; EBS volumes are confined to a single AZ by default.

question: Sarah has deployed an application in the Northern California (us-west-1) region. After examining the application’s traffic, she notices that about 30% of the traffic is coming from Asia. What can she do to reduce latency for the users in Asia?

options.A: Replicate the current resources across multiple Availability Zones within the same region.
options.B: Migrate the application to a hosting provider in Asia.
options.D: Create a CDN using CloudFront, so that content is cached at Edge Locations close to and in Asia.

explanation: Creating a CloudFront distribution caches the website's content at edge locations near Asian users, dramatically reducing round-trip latency without moving the origin. Replicating across AZs within the same region does not help users geographically far away; migrating to an Asian hosting provider involves operational complexity; recreating content does not reduce latency.

question: Using Amazon EC2 falls under which of the following cloud computing models?
explanation: Amazon EC2 is Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)—AWS provides the virtual compute infrastructure, but the customer manages the operating system, middleware, and applications. It is not SaaS (software fully managed by the vendor) or PaaS (platform where the customer only manages the application code).

question: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following controls do customers fully inherit from AWS? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Physical controls (data center physical security, hardware) and environmental controls (power, cooling, fire suppression) are entirely managed by AWS—customers have no access and fully inherit these from AWS's responsibility. Patch management, database controls, and awareness/training are shared controls where both AWS and the customer have independent responsibilities.

question: Which of the following should be considered when performing a TCO analysis to compare the costs of running an application on AWS instead of on-premises?
explanation: A comprehensive TCO analysis comparing on-premises to AWS must include the cost of physical hardware (servers, networking, storage) that must be purchased on-premises but is replaced by AWS's managed infrastructure. Application development and business analysis costs remain relatively constant regardless of where you host, and market research is not a TCO component.

question: Which of the following statements describes the AWS Cloud’s agility?

options.A: AWS allows you to host your applications in multiple regions around the world.
options.B: AWS provides customizable hardware at the lowest possible cost.
options.C: AWS allows you to provision resources in minutes.
options.D: AWS allows you to pay upfront to reduce costs.

explanation: AWS Cloud agility refers to the ability to provision infrastructure resources in minutes through the console, CLI, or API—dramatically faster than the weeks or months required for on-premises hardware procurement. Hosting in multiple regions describes global reach; customizable hardware describes a different benefit; upfront payment is the opposite of cloud economics.

question: What is the connectivity option that uses Internet Protocol Security (IPSec) to establish encrypted connectivity between an on-premises network and the AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS Site-to-Site VPN uses IPSec to create an encrypted tunnel between your on-premises network and an AWS VPC over the public internet, providing secure connectivity. Internet Gateway connects a VPC to the internet; AWS IQ connects customers with AWS experts; Direct Connect is a dedicated private circuit (not IPSec over the internet).

question: Which AWS Service provides the current status of all AWS Services in all AWS Regions?
explanation: The AWS Service Health Dashboard (status.aws.amazon.com) provides a real-time, public view of the operational status of all AWS services across all Regions. The Personal Health Dashboard shows alerts specific to your account's resources; CloudWatch monitors your application metrics; the Management Console is the AWS administrative interface.

question: A company has hundreds of VPCs in multiple AWS Regions worldwide. What service does AWS offer to simplify the connection management among the VPCs?
explanation: AWS Transit Gateway is a network hub that allows you to connect thousands of VPCs and on-premises networks through a central, fully managed gateway—simplifying the management of complex, large-scale network topologies. VPC Peering requires individual one-to-one connections between each VPC pair; Amazon Connect is a contact center service; Security Groups operate at the instance level.

question: Why does every AWS Region contain multiple Availability Zones?

options.A: Multiple Availability Zones allows you to build resilient and highly available architectures.
options.B: Multiple Availability Zones results in lower total cost compared to deploying in a single Availability Zone.
options.C: Multiple Availability Zones allows for data replication and global reach.
options.D: Multiple Availability Zones within a region increases the storage capacity available in that region.

explanation: Multiple Availability Zones within a Region are geographically separated, each with independent power, cooling, and networking, so a failure in one AZ does not affect others. This architecture allows you to deploy resilient, highly available applications that continue running even if a complete AZ fails.

question: Which of the following is a benefit of running an application in multiple Availability Zones?

options.A: Allows you to exceed AWS service limits.
options.B: Reduces application response time between servers and global users.
options.D: Increases the availability of your application.

explanation: Deploying applications across multiple Availability Zones means that if one AZ experiences an outage, the application continues running from the remaining AZ(s), directly increasing availability. Multi-AZ does not allow you to exceed service limits, reduce global latency (that requires multiple Regions or CloudFront), or increase compute capacity.

question: A company needs to migrate their website from on-premises to AWS. Security is a major concern for them, so they need to host their website on hardware that is NOT shared with other AWS customers. Which of the following EC2 instance options meets this requirement?
explanation: EC2 Dedicated Instances run on hardware that is physically isolated at the host hardware level and is not shared with any other AWS customer account, meeting the physical isolation compliance requirement. On-Demand and Spot Instances run on shared hardware; Reserved Instances are a pricing model, not a tenancy type.

question: Which statement best describes the concept of an AWS region?

options.A: An AWS Region is a geographical location with a collection of Edge locations.
options.B: An AWS Region is a virtual network dedicated only to a single AWS customer.
options.C: An AWS Region is a geographical location with a collection of Availability Zones.
options.D: An AWS Region represents the country where the AWS infrastructure exist.

explanation: An AWS Region is a physical geographic location that contains a cluster of Availability Zones, each consisting of one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity.

question: Why would an organization decide to use AWS over an on-premises data center? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS provides elastic resources that scale up and down with demand, eliminating the need to over-provision, and offers cost savings through pay-as-you-go pricing that avoids large upfront capital investments.

question: TYMO Cloud Corp is looking forward to migrating their entire on-premises data center to AWS. What tool can they use to perform a cost-benefit analysis of moving to the AWS Cloud?
explanation: The AWS TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) Calculator helps organizations compare the cost of running workloads on-premises versus on AWS, factoring in infrastructure, labor, and operational expenses.

question: Why do many startup companies prefer AWS over traditional on-premises solutions? (Choose TWO)

options.A: AWS allows them to pay later when their business succeed.
options.B: AWS can build complete data centers faster than any other Cloud provider.
options.C: Using AWS, they can reduce time-to-market by focusing on business activities rather than on building and managing data centers.
options.D: AWS removes the need to invest in operational expenditure.
options.E: Using AWS allows companies to replace large capital expenditure with low variable costs.

explanation: Startups prefer AWS because they can replace large upfront capital expenditure with low variable pay-as-you-go costs, and reduce time-to-market by focusing on product development instead of building and managing data centers.

question: Which of the following factors should be considered when determining the region in which AWS Resources will be deployed? (Choose TWO)

options.E: Geographic proximity to the company's location.

explanation: Data sovereignty requirements dictate that data must stay in specific geographic locations, and cost varies by Region. Both are critical factors when choosing where to deploy AWS resources.

question: Which AWS Service helps enterprises extend their on-premises storage to AWS in a cost-effective manner?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway connects on-premises environments to AWS cloud storage, providing seamless integration that lets enterprises extend their existing storage infrastructure to S3, EBS, or Glacier cost-effectively.

question: Which of the following should be taken into account when performing a TCO analysis regarding the costs of running an application on AWS VS on-premises? (Choose TWO)
explanation: A TCO analysis compares on-premises costs (including labor, IT staff, cooling, and power consumption) against AWS costs, where these physical infrastructure expenses are eliminated.

question: An organization has a legacy application designed using monolithic-based architecture. Which AWS Service can be used to decouple the components of the application?
explanation: Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a fully managed message queuing service that decouples application components by letting them communicate asynchronously through messages instead of direct calls.

question: Availability Zones within a Region are connected over low-latency links. Which of the following is a benefit of these links?

options.A: Create private connection to your data center.
options.C: Automate the process of provisioning new compute resources.
options.D: Make synchronous replication of your data possible.

explanation: Low-latency links between Availability Zones within a Region enable synchronous data replication, ensuring that data written in one AZ is immediately available in another for high availability.

question: Which of the following is true regarding the AWS availability zones and edge locations?

options.A: Edge locations are located in separate Availability Zones worldwide to serve global customers.
options.B: An availability zone exists within an edge location to distribute content globally with low latency.
options.C: An Availability Zone is a geographic location where AWS provides multiple, physically separated and isolated edge locations.
options.D: An AWS Availability Zone is an isolated location within an AWS Region, however edge locations are located in multiple cities worldwide.

explanation: Availability Zones are isolated locations within an AWS Region (each with independent power, cooling, and networking), while edge locations are separate infrastructure points distributed across hundreds of cities worldwide for content delivery.

question: Which of the following are advantages of using AWS as a cloud computing provider? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Eliminates the need to monitor servers and applications.
options.B: Manages all the compliance and auditing tasks.
options.C: Provides custom hardware to meet any specification.
options.D: Eliminates the need to guess on infrastructure capacity needs.
options.E: Enables customers to trade their capital expenses for operational expenses.

explanation: AWS eliminates the need to guess infrastructure capacity by providing on-demand scaling, and it lets customers trade large upfront capital expenses for smaller, variable operational expenses based on actual usage.

question: You need to migrate a large number of on-premises workloads to AWS. Which AWS service is the most appropriate?
explanation: AWS Server Migration Service (SMS) automates the migration of on-premises workloads to AWS by incrementally replicating server VMs as Amazon Machine Images (AMIs), making it ideal for large-scale migrations.

question: Which of the following is a cloud computing deployment model that connects infrastructure and applications between cloud-based resources and existing resources not located in the cloud?
explanation: A hybrid cloud deployment model connects cloud-based resources with existing on-premises infrastructure, allowing organizations to extend their data center into the cloud while maintaining some workloads locally.

question: A company is hosting business critical workloads in an AWS Region. To protect against data loss and ensure business continuity, a mirror image of the current AWS environment should be created in another AWS Region. Company policy requires that the standby environment must be available in minutes in case of an outage in the primary AWS Region. Which AWS service can be used to meet these requirements?
explanation: CloudEndure Disaster Recovery continuously replicates your machines into a staging area in another AWS Region and can launch fully provisioned instances within minutes during an outage, providing fast cross-Region failover.

question: Which tool can a non-AWS customer use to compare the cost of on-premises environment resources to AWS?
explanation: The AWS TCO Calculator is designed specifically for organizations comparing on-premises costs to AWS, providing a detailed cost-benefit analysis even before they have an AWS account.

question: An organization uses a hybrid cloud architecture to run their business. Which AWS service enables them to deploy their applications to any AWS or on-premises server?
explanation: AWS CodeDeploy automates application deployments to Amazon EC2 instances, on-premises servers, Lambda functions, or ECS services, making it well suited for hybrid cloud deployment workflows.

question: A developer wants to quickly deploy and manage his application in the AWS Cloud, but he doesn’t have any experience with cloud computing. Which of the following AWS services would help the developer achieve his goal?
explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk handles deployment, capacity provisioning, load balancing, auto-scaling, and health monitoring automatically, letting developers deploy applications without deep cloud experience.

question: You want to transfer 200 Terabytes of data from on-premises locations to the AWS Cloud, which of the following can do the job in a cost-effective way?
explanation: AWS Snowball is a physical data transport device that can move up to 80 TB per device, making it cost-effective for transferring 200 TB of data without relying on slow or expensive network transfers.

question: Which of the following AWS services would help you migrate on-premise databases to AWS?
explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) migrates databases from on-premises to AWS with minimal downtime, supporting both homogeneous and heterogeneous migrations while keeping the source database operational.

question: A company has infrastructure hosted in an on-premises data center. They currently have an operations team that takes care of identity management. If they decide to migrate to the AWS cloud, which of the following services would help them perform the same role in AWS?
explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) provides centralized control over authentication and authorization for AWS resources, serving the same identity management role as an on-premises operations team.

question: You have developed a web application targeting a global audience. Which of the following will help you achieve the highest redundancy and fault tolerance from an infrastructure perspective?

options.A: There is no need to architect for these capabilities in AWS, as AWS is redundant by default.
options.B: Deploy the application in a single Availability Zone.
options.C: Deploy the application in multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS region.
options.D: Deploy the application in multiple Availability Zones in multiple AWS regions.

explanation: Deploying across multiple Availability Zones in multiple AWS Regions provides the highest level of redundancy and fault tolerance, protecting against both AZ-level failures and Region-wide outages.

question: For some services, AWS automatically replicates data across multiple Availability Zones to provide fault tolerance in the event of a server failure or Availability Zone outage. Select TWO services that automatically replicate data across Availability Zones.
explanation: Amazon S3 automatically replicates objects across a minimum of three Availability Zones within a Region, and Amazon DynamoDB replicates data across multiple AZs by default, both providing built-in fault tolerance.

question: Which of the following is the responsibility of AWS according to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model?
explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, AWS is responsible for securing the physical infrastructure, including Regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations that make up the AWS global network.

question: Which AWS service can be used to route end users to the nearest AWS Region to reduce latency?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 supports latency-based routing, which directs users to the AWS Region that provides the lowest network latency for their location, reducing response times for global applications.

question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, what are the controls that customers fully inherit from AWS? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Inherited controls are those the customer fully inherits from AWS without needing to manage themselves. Data center security controls and environmental controls (power, cooling, fire suppression) are fully managed by AWS.

question: Which of the following Cloud Computing deployment models eliminates the need to run and maintain physical data centers?
explanation: The cloud deployment model eliminates the need to run and maintain physical data centers entirely, as all infrastructure is hosted and managed by the cloud provider in their facilities.

question: What is the benefit of Amazon EBS volumes being automatically replicated within the same availability zone?
explanation: Amazon EBS volumes are automatically replicated within their Availability Zone to protect against hardware failures, providing durability by ensuring that data survives individual component failures.

question: The elasticity of the AWS Cloud enables customers to save costs when compared to traditional hosting providers. What can AWS customers do to benefit from the elasticity of the AWS Cloud? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Deploy your resources across multiple Availability Zones.
options.C: Deploy your resources in another region.

explanation: EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts instance counts based on demand to avoid paying for idle capacity, and serverless computing (Lambda, Fargate) charges only for actual execution time, both leveraging cloud elasticity for cost savings.

question: Each AWS Region is composed of multiple Availability Zones. Which of the following best describes what an Availability Zone is?

options.A: It is a data center designed to be completely isolated from other data centers in the same region.
options.B: It is a collection of data centers distributed in multiple countries.
options.C: It is a logically isolated network of the AWS Cloud.
options.D: It is a distinct location within a region that is insulated from « failures in other Availability Zones.

explanation: An Availability Zone is a distinct location within a Region consisting of one or more data centers, designed to be isolated from failures in other AZs through independent power, cooling, and networking.

question: AWS provides disaster recovery capability by allowing customers to deploy infrastructure into multiple [...].
explanation: AWS Regions are geographically separate locations around the world. Deploying infrastructure across multiple Regions provides disaster recovery by ensuring operations continue even if an entire Region is affected.

question: Which element of the AWS global infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers each with redundant power networking and connectivity which are housed in separate facilities?
explanation: An Availability Zone consists of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, housed in separate facilities within a Region.

question: How many Availability Zones should compute resources be provisioned across to achieve high availability?

options.D: A minimum of four or more.

explanation: A minimum of two Availability Zones is required for high availability, ensuring that if one AZ fails, the application continues operating from the other with minimal disruption.

question: The AWS Cloud’s multiple Regions are an example of:
explanation: AWS Regions spread across the globe are part of the AWS global infrastructure, which includes Regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations designed to deliver services worldwide.

question: Which AWS service allows companies to connect an Amazon VPC to an on-premises data center? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS VPN creates an encrypted connection over the public internet, and AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private network connection. Both enable secure connectivity between an Amazon VPC and an on-premises data center.

question: Which task is AWS responsible for in the shared responsibility model for security and compliance?

options.A: Granting access to individuals and services.

explanation: Updating the host firmware on EC2 physical servers is AWS's responsibility under the Shared Responsibility Model. Customers are responsible for their own OS updates, data encryption, and access management.

question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model what is the sole responsibility of AWS?
explanation: Managing edge locations (the physical infrastructure used by CloudFront and other services) is solely AWS's responsibility. Patch management is shared, and application security and client-side data are the customer's responsibility.

question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following activities are the customer’s responsibility? (Select TWO)

options.A: Patching operating system components for Amazon Relational Database Server (Amazon RDS).
options.E: Maintaining environmental controls within a data center.

explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting data on the client side before sending it to AWS, and for configuring Network ACLs to control inbound and outbound traffic at the subnet level in their VPC.

question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is a shared control between a customer and AWS?
explanation: Patch management is a shared control: AWS patches the underlying infrastructure and managed service platforms, while customers patch their own guest operating systems and applications.

question: Which AWS feature should a customer leverage to achieve high availability of an application?
explanation: Availability Zones are physically separate locations within a Region with independent infrastructure. Deploying across multiple AZs ensures your application remains available even if one zone fails.

question: Which of the following are main components of the AWS global infrastructure? (Select TWO)
explanation: Regions and Availability Zones are the two main building blocks of the AWS global infrastructure. Regions are geographic areas, and each Region contains multiple isolated Availability Zones.

question: What is the AWS customer responsible for according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, data encryption is the customer's responsibility. Customers choose how and whether to encrypt their data at rest and in transit using AWS-provided tools or their own.

question: What costs are included when comparing AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) with on-premises TCO?
explanation: On-premises TCO includes data center security costs (guards, access controls, surveillance) that are eliminated when moving to AWS, where physical security is AWS's responsibility.

question: Which AWS services are defined as global instead of regional? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a global DNS service not tied to any specific Region, and Amazon CloudFront is a global CDN that operates from edge locations worldwide. Both function as global services.

question: What AWS team assists customers with accelerating cloud adoption through paid engagements in any of several specialty practice area ?
explanation: AWS Professional Services is a team of experts that assists customers through paid engagements in specialty areas like migration, cloud adoption strategy, and architecture optimization.

question: Which AWS feature will reduce the customer's total cost of ownership (TCO)?
explanation: Elastic computing lets you match resource capacity to actual demand, scaling up during peaks and down during lulls, which eliminates paying for idle infrastructure and directly reduces total cost of ownership.

question: Which feature of the AWS Cloud will support an international company's requirement for low latency to all of its customers?
explanation: AWS's global reach — with Regions and edge locations spread worldwide — allows companies to deploy resources close to their international customers, directly reducing network latency.

question: A customer is deploying a new application and needs to choose an AWS Region. Which of the following factors could influence the customer's decision? (Select TWO.)

options.B: The application's presentation in the local language
options.E: Proximity to the customer's office for on-site visits

explanation: Choosing a Region close to end users reduces network latency, and data sovereignty compliance requirements may mandate that data stays within specific geographic boundaries. Both directly influence Region selection.

question: The AWS Cloud's multiple Regions are an example of:
explanation: AWS Regions distributed across the globe are a core component of the AWS global infrastructure, providing customers with geographic diversity for deploying workloads close to their users.

question: Which design principles for cloud architecture are recommended when re-architecting a large monolithic application? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Loose coupling reduces inter-component dependencies so failures don't cascade, and designing for scalability ensures each component can independently handle varying loads. Both are essential when breaking apart a monolith.

question: How do customers benefit from Amazon's massive economies of scale?

options.A: Periodic price reductions as the result of Amazon's operational efficiencies
options.B: New Amazon EC2 instance types providing the latest hardware
options.C: The ability to scale up and down when needed
options.D: Increased reliability in the underlying hardware of Amazon EC2 instances

explanation: AWS passes its operational efficiencies and massive purchasing power to customers through periodic price reductions, lowering the cost of cloud services as AWS's scale grows.

question: What can AWS edge locations be used for? (Select TWO.)

options.D: Reducing traffic on the server by caching responses
options.E: Sending notification messages to end users

explanation: AWS edge locations deliver cached content closer to end users via CloudFront, reducing latency, and they also reduce load on origin servers by serving cached responses directly from the edge.

question: Which AWS services are defined as global instead of regional? (Select TWO.)
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a global DNS service that operates across all Regions, and Amazon CloudFront is a global CDN that distributes content from edge locations worldwide. Neither is tied to a specific Region.

question: Which of the following are benefits of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
explanation: Elasticity allows you to automatically scale resources up and down based on demand, and agility enables rapid provisioning and experimentation. Both are core advantages of the AWS Cloud over traditional infrastructure.

question: What are the multiple, isolated locations within an AWS Region that are connected by low-latency networks called?
explanation: Availability Zones are multiple, isolated locations within an AWS Region, each with independent power, cooling, and networking, connected to each other by low-latency links for high availability.

question: When comparing AWS Cloud with on-premises Total Cost of Ownership, which expenses must be considered? (Choose two.)
explanation: TCO analysis must include physical hardware costs like storage hardware and physical servers that exist on-premises but are eliminated when moving to AWS, where infrastructure is a variable operational expense.

question: Which scenarios represent the concept of elasticity on AWS? (Choose two.)

options.A: Scaling the number of Amazon EC2 instances based on traffic.
options.B: Resizing Amazon RDS instances as business needs change.
options.C: Automatically directing traffic to less-utilized Amazon EC2 instances.
options.D: Using AWS compliance documents to accelerate the compliance process.
options.E: Having the ability to create and govern environments using code.

explanation: Scaling EC2 instances based on traffic is a classic example of elasticity (horizontal scaling), and resizing RDS instances as needs change demonstrates elasticity through vertical scaling. Both adapt resources to match demand.

question: A company is considering moving its on-premises data center to AWS. What factors should be included in doing a Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) analysis? (Choose two.)

options.B: Power consumption of the data center
options.C: Labor costs to replace old servers

explanation: TCO analysis should include power consumption of the data center and labor costs to replace old servers, as these are significant on-premises expenses eliminated when migrating to AWS.

question: A company is designing an application hosted in a single AWS Region serving end-users spread across the world. The company wants to provide the end-users low latency access to the application data. Which of the following services will help fulfill this requirement?

options.D: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) transfer acceleration

explanation: Amazon CloudFront caches application data at edge locations worldwide, serving content to end users from the nearest edge location to minimize latency, even when the application is hosted in a single Region.

question: What feature of Amazon RDS helps to create globally redundant databases?
explanation: Amazon RDS Cross-Region read replicas create copies of your database in other AWS Regions, providing globally redundant database access for disaster recovery and low-latency reads for international users.

question: Which feature adds elasticity to Amazon EC2 instances to handle the changing demand for workloads?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances based on demand conditions you define, adding elasticity by scaling out during peaks and scaling in during lulls.

question: Which architectural principle is used when deploying an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance in Multiple Availability Zone mode?

options.C: Automate everything that can be automated.

explanation: Deploying RDS in Multi-AZ mode applies the design for failure principle by maintaining a synchronous standby replica in another AZ, automatically failing over if the primary becomes unavailable.

question: A company's web application currently has tight dependencies on underlying components, so when one component fails the entire web application fails. Applying which AWS Cloud design principle will address the current design issue?

options.A: Implementing elasticity, enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
options.B: Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
options.C: Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.
options.D: Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.

explanation: Decoupling components means isolating them so each can function independently. When one component fails, the others continue operating because they communicate through asynchronous interfaces like queues rather than direct calls.

question: Which of the following is an AWS Well-Architected Framework design principle related to reliability?

options.A: Deployment to a single Availability Zone

explanation: The ability to recover from failure is a core design principle of the Reliability pillar, which focuses on ensuring workloads perform their intended function correctly and consistently, including automatic recovery mechanisms.

question: Why should a company choose AWS instead of a traditional data center?

options.A: AWS provides users with full control over the underlying resources.
options.B: AWS does not require long-term contracts and provides a pay-as-you-go model.
options.C: AWS offers edge locations in every country, supporting global reach.
options.D: AWS has no limits on the number of resources that can be created.

explanation: AWS does not require long-term contracts and uses a pay-as-you-go pricing model, allowing companies to start small, scale as needed, and only pay for what they actually use.

question: Which solution provides the FASTEST application response times to frequently accessed data to users in multiple AWS Regions?

options.A: AWS CloudTrail across multiple Availability Zones
options.D: A virtual private gateway over AWS Direct Connect

explanation: Amazon CloudFront caches content at edge locations worldwide, delivering frequently accessed data from the location nearest to users for the fastest possible response times across multiple Regions.

question: A startup is working on a new application that needs to go to market quickly. The application requirements may need to be adjusted in the near future. Which of the following is a characteristic of the AWS Cloud that would meet this specific need?
explanation: Agility in the AWS Cloud means the ability to quickly provision resources, iterate on application requirements, and deploy changes rapidly — enabling startups to go to market fast and adapt as needs change.

question: When building a cloud Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) model, which cost elements should be considered for workloads running on AWS? (Choose three.)
explanation: When building a cloud TCO model for AWS workloads, the key cost elements are compute costs (EC2, Lambda), storage costs (S3, EBS), and data transfer costs (outbound bandwidth charges).

question: When comparing AWS with on-premises Total Cost of Ownership (TCO), what costs are included?
explanation: Data center security costs (physical access controls, surveillance, guards) are part of on-premises TCO that are eliminated when migrating to AWS, where physical security is included in the service.

question: Which principles are used to architect applications for reliability on the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.D: Test for moderate demand to ensure reliability
options.E: Backup recovery to an on-premises environment

explanation: Designing for automated failure recovery ensures systems self-heal without manual intervention, and deploying across multiple Availability Zones protects against AZ-level failures. Both are core reliability principles.

question: What is an example of high availability in the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Consulting AWS technical support at any time day or night
options.B: Ensuring an application remains accessible, even if a resource fails
options.C: Making any AWS service available for use by paying on demand
options.D: Deploying in any part of the world using AWS Regions

explanation: High availability means an application remains accessible even when individual resources fail, achieved through redundancy across Availability Zones, auto-scaling, and automatic failover mechanisms.

question: Which services use AWS edge locations? (Choose two.)
explanation: Amazon CloudFront delivers content from edge locations worldwide, and AWS Shield provides DDoS protection at edge locations. Both services leverage the AWS edge location infrastructure.

question: Which benefit of the AWS Cloud supports matching the supply of resources with changing workload demands?
explanation: Elasticity is the ability to automatically scale resources up or down to match changing workload demands, ensuring you have the right amount of capacity without over-provisioning or under-provisioning.

question: What are the benefits of using the AWS Cloud for companies with customers in many countries around the world? (Choose two.)

options.A: Companies can deploy applications in multiple AWS Regions to reduce latency.
options.B: Amazon Translate automatically translates third-party website interfaces into multiple languages.
options.C: Amazon CloudFront has multiple edge locations around the world to reduce latency.
options.D: Amazon Comprehend allows users to build applications that can respond to user requests in many languages.
options.E: Elastic Load Balancing can distribute application web traffic to multiple AWS Regions around the world, which reduces latency.

explanation: Deploying in multiple AWS Regions places resources near international users for lower latency, and Amazon CloudFront's global edge locations cache content close to end users worldwide for faster delivery.

question: When a company provisions web servers in multiple AWS Regions, what is being increased?
explanation: Provisioning web servers across multiple AWS Regions increases availability by ensuring that if one entire Region experiences an outage, users can be served from servers in another Region.

question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose two.)
explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework has six pillars: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization, and Sustainability. Performance Efficiency and Security are two of them.

question: Treating infrastructure as code in the AWS Cloud allows users to:

options.A: automate migration of on-premises hardware to AWS data centers.
options.B: let a third party automate an audit of the AWS infrastructure.
options.C: turn over application code to AWS so it can run on the AWS infrastructure.

explanation: Infrastructure as code allows users to automate the provisioning process by defining resources in templates (like AWS CloudFormation), enabling repeatable, version-controlled deployments.

question: What are the benefits of developing and running a new application in the AWS Cloud compared to on-premises? (Choose two.)

options.A: AWS automatically distributes the data globally for higher durability.
options.B: AWS will take care of operating the application.
options.C: AWS makes it easy to architect for high availability.
options.D: AWS can easily accommodate application demand changes.
options.E: AWS takes care application security patching.

explanation: AWS makes it easy to architect for high availability through multi-AZ deployments and managed services, and can easily accommodate demand changes through elasticity and auto-scaling.

question: What are the immediate benefits of using the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.B: Capital expenses are replaced with variable expenses.
options.E: AWS holds responsibility for security in the cloud.

explanation: Moving to AWS immediately replaces capital expenses with variable pay-as-you-go expenses, and increases agility by enabling rapid provisioning of resources in minutes instead of weeks.

question: What should users do if they want to install an application in geographically isolated locations?

options.A: Install the application using multiple internet gateways.
options.B: Deploy the application to an Amazon VPC.
options.C: Deploy the application to multiple AWS Regions.
options.D: Configure the application using multiple NAT gateways.

explanation: Deploying an application to multiple AWS Regions places it in geographically isolated locations around the world, each with independent infrastructure for maximum geographic separation.

question: A system in the AWS Cloud is designed to withstand the failure of one or more components. What is this an example of?
explanation: A system designed to withstand component failures is an example of high availability, which ensures the application remains accessible through redundancy and automatic failover mechanisms.

question: Which of the following describes the relationships among AWS Regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations? (Choose two.)

options.A: There are more AWS Regions than Availability Zones.
options.B: There are more edge locations than AWS Regions.
options.C: An edge location is an Availability Zone.
options.D: There are more AWS Regions than edge locations.
options.E: There are more Availability Zones than AWS Regions.

explanation: There are more edge locations than AWS Regions (hundreds of edge locations vs. dozens of Regions), and there are more Availability Zones than Regions (each Region has multiple AZs).

question: What are the advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.B: No need to guess capacity requirements
options.E: Physical access to cloud data centers

explanation: AWS eliminates the need to guess capacity requirements by providing on-demand scaling, and increases speed to market by enabling rapid provisioning of resources in minutes.

question: What helps a company provide a lower latency experience to its users globally?

options.A: Using an AWS Region that is central to all users
options.B: Using a second Availability Zone in the AWS Region that is using used
options.C: Enabling caching in the AWS Region that is being used
options.D: Using edge locations to put content closer to all users

explanation: Edge locations place cached content closer to users globally through Amazon CloudFront, providing the lowest possible latency regardless of where the origin server is located.

question: Which Amazon RDS feature can be used to achieve high availability?
explanation: Amazon RDS Multi-AZ deployment maintains a synchronous standby replica in a different Availability Zone, providing automatic failover for high availability if the primary instance fails.

question: What is an AWS Cloud design best practice?
explanation: High availability is an AWS Cloud design best practice that ensures applications remain accessible through redundancy, multi-AZ deployments, and automatic failover mechanisms.

question: Which AWS service would simplify migration of a database to AWS?
explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) simplifies database migration by continuously replicating data from the source to the target database with minimal downtime, supporting both homogeneous and heterogeneous migrations.

question: Which component of AWS global infrastructure does Amazon CloudFront use to ensure low-latency delivery?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront uses AWS edge locations — distributed across hundreds of cities worldwide — to cache and deliver content from the location nearest to each user for low-latency delivery.

question: When designing a typical three-tier web application, which AWS services and/or features improve availability and reduce the impact failures? (Choose two.)

options.A: AWS Auto Scaling for Amazon EC2 instances
options.B: Amazon VPC subnet ACLs to check the health of a service
options.C: Distributed resources across multiple Availability Zones
options.D: AWS Server Migration Service (AWS SMS) to move Amazon EC2 instances into a different Region
options.E: Distributed resources across multiple AWS points of presence

explanation: AWS Auto Scaling automatically replaces unhealthy instances and adjusts capacity, and distributing resources across multiple Availability Zones provides redundancy. Both improve availability and reduce failure impact.

question: Which cloud design principle aligns with AWS Cloud best practices?

options.A: Create fixed dependencies among application components
options.B: Aggregate services on a single instance
options.C: Deploy applications in a single Availability Zone
options.D: Distribute the compute load across multiple resources

explanation: Distributing compute load across multiple resources follows the horizontal scaling best practice, improving fault tolerance and performance by avoiding single points of failure.

question: A company is migrating from on-premises data centers to the AWS Cloud and is looking for hands-on help with the project. How can the company get this support? (Choose two.)

options.A: Ask for a quote from the AWS Marketplace team to perform a migration into the company's AWS account.
options.B: Contact AWS Support and open a case for assistance
options.C: Use AWS Professional Services to provide guidance and to set up an AWS Landing Zone in the company's AWS account
options.D: Select a partner from the AWS Partner Network (APN) to assist with the migration
options.E: Use Amazon Connect to create a new request for proposal (RFP) for expert assistance in migrating to the AWS Cloud.

explanation: AWS Professional Services provides hands-on migration guidance and Landing Zone setup, and AWS Partner Network (APN) partners offer specialized migration consulting and implementation support.

question: An application designed to span multiple Availability Zones is described as:
explanation: An application spanning multiple Availability Zones is described as highly available because it can continue operating even if one AZ experiences an outage.

question: A new service using AWS must be highly available. Yet, due to regulatory requirements, all of its Amazon EC2 instances must be located in a single geographic area. According to best practices, to meet these requirements, the EC2 instances must be placed in at least two:
explanation: To achieve high availability within a single geographic area, EC2 instances should be placed in at least two Availability Zones within the same Region, providing redundancy while meeting data residency requirements.

question: Which situation should be reported to the AWS Abuse team?

options.A: In Availability Zone has a service disruption
options.B: An intrusion attempt is made from an AWS IP address
options.C: A user has trouble accessing an Amazon S3 bucket from an AWS IP address
options.D: A user needs to change payment methods due to a compromise

explanation: Intrusion attempts from AWS IP addresses are abuse scenarios that should be reported to the AWS Abuse team, which investigates misuse of AWS resources for malicious activities.

question: A company is planning to launch an ecommerce site in a single AWS Region to a worldwide user base. Which AWS services will allow the company to reach users and provide low latency and high transfer speeds? (Choose two.)
explanation: AWS Global Accelerator routes traffic over the AWS global network to optimal endpoints, and Amazon CloudFront caches content at edge locations. Both provide low latency and high speeds for worldwide users.

question: Which of the following are advantages of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)

options.A: AWS manages the maintenance of the cloud infrastructure
options.B: AWS manages the security of applications built on AWS
options.C: AWS manages capacity planning for physical servers
options.D: AWS manages the development of applications on AWS
options.E: AWS manages cost planning for virtual servers

explanation: AWS manages the maintenance of cloud infrastructure (hardware, networking, facilities) and manages capacity planning for physical servers, freeing customers from these operational burdens.

question: A user deploys an Amazon RDS DB instance in multiple Availability Zones. This strategy involves which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?
explanation: Deploying an RDS instance across multiple Availability Zones aligns with the Reliability pillar, which focuses on ensuring workloads recover from failures and meet availability requirements.

question: Which element of the AWS global infrastructure consists of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, which are housed in separate facilities?
explanation: An Availability Zone consists of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity, housed in separate facilities within an AWS Region.

question: What can assist in evaluating an application for migration to the cloud? (Choose two.)
explanation: AWS Professional Services provides expert guidance for cloud migration assessments, and AWS Partner Network (APN) partners offer specialized migration evaluation services. Both help assess applications for cloud readiness.

question: What is a characteristic of Amazon S3 cross-region replication?

options.A: Both source and destination S3 buckets must have versioning disabled
options.B: The source and destination S3 buckets cannot be in different AWS Regions
options.C: S3 buckets configured for cross-region replication can be owned by a single AWS account or by different accounts
options.D: The source S3 bucket owner must have the source and destination AWS Regions disabled for their account

explanation: S3 cross-region replication supports buckets owned by a single AWS account or by different accounts, enabling cross-account replication scenarios for data sharing and compliance.

question: A company that does business online needs to quickly deliver new functionality in an iterative manner, minimizing the time to market. Which AWS Cloud feature can provide this?
explanation: Agility in the AWS Cloud enables companies to quickly provision resources, iterate on features, and deploy changes rapidly, minimizing time to market for new functionality.

question: A company wants to use an AWS service to monitor the health of application endpoints, with the ability to route traffic to healthy regional endpoints to improve application availability. Which service will support these requirements?
explanation: AWS Global Accelerator monitors the health of application endpoints and automatically routes traffic to the nearest healthy regional endpoint, improving application availability and performance.

question: The ability to horizontally scale Amazon EC2 instances based on demand is an example of which concept in the AWS Cloud value proposition?
explanation: Horizontally scaling EC2 instances based on demand is elasticity — the ability to automatically add or remove compute resources to match workload requirements in real time.

question: IT systems should be designed to reduce interdependencies, so that a change or failure in one component does not cascade to other components. This is an example of which principle of cloud architecture design?
explanation: Loose coupling reduces interdependencies between components so that a change or failure in one does not cascade to others, improving system resilience through independent, isolated components.

question: What is the benefit of elasticity in the AWS Cloud?

options.A: Ensure web traffic is automatically spread across multiple AWS Regions.
options.B: Minimize storage costs by automatically archiving log data.
options.C: Enable AWS to automatically select the most cost-effective services.
options.D: Automatically adjust the required compute capacity to maintain consistent performance.

explanation: Elasticity automatically adjusts compute capacity to maintain consistent performance as demand changes, scaling out during traffic peaks and scaling in during lulls without manual intervention.

question: The continual reduction of AWS Cloud pricing is due to:
explanation: Economies of scale drive continual AWS price reductions — as AWS grows and serves more customers, it achieves lower per-unit costs and passes those savings on through regular price decreases.

question: Which AWS Cloud best practice uses the elasticity and agility of cloud computing?

options.A: Provision capacity based on past usage and theoretical peaks
options.B: Dynamically and predictively scale to meet usage demands
options.C: Build the application and infrastructure in a data center that grants physical access
options.D: Break apart the application into loosely coupled components

explanation: Dynamically and predictively scaling to meet usage demands leverages both elasticity (automatic scaling) and agility (rapid adaptation), which are core cloud computing advantages.

question: Which of the AWS global infrastructure is used to cache copies of content for faster delivery to users across the globe?
explanation: Edge locations are points of presence in the AWS global infrastructure used by CloudFront and other services to cache copies of content close to end users for faster delivery worldwide.

question: Using AWS Config to record, audit, and evaluate changes to AWS resources to enable traceability is an example of which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar?
explanation: Using AWS Config for traceability — recording, auditing, and evaluating changes to resources — is an example of the Security pillar, which emphasizes protecting information and systems through detective controls.

question: A Cloud Practitioner is developing a disaster recovery plan and intends to replicate data between multiple geographic areas. Which of the following meets these requirements?
